newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cr Foncier sees 1997 profit, needs recap.
newsitem.headline: Cr Foncier sees 1997 profit, needs recap.

text.p: French home loans group Credit Foncier said on Friday it expected to make a profit again in 1997, after returning to profit for 1996 from a huge loss of more than 10.5 billion francs the year before.
The group also said at a news conference that it needed a recpaitalisation of 2.5-3.0 billion francs.

On Thursday Credit Foncier, which recently won a stay of execution from a government-orchestrated break-up plan to allow it seek a rescue partner, said it had made a net attributable profit of 858 million francs in 1996.
"The 1997 result will be positive," Credit Foncier chairman Jerome Meyssonnier told reporters.

Reaching a Cooke solvency ratio of eight percent would require between 2.5 and three billion francs on top of the 3.8 billion francs in shareholder funds as of the end of 1996, accounting for latent capital gains, he said.

The government commissioned a takeover of Credit Foncier last year by state bank Caisse de Depots but has held off on the second phase of a plan to break up the group and recently given Credit Foncier a second chance to try to find a rescue partner after a first bid came to nothing last year.
